004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.pidwrappers;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogGyro;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogInput;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType;
011
012/**
013 * Wrapper so that PIDSource is implemented for AnalogGyro for old PIDController.
014 *
015 * <p>This class is provided by the OldCommands VendorDep
016 *
017 * @deprecated Use {@link edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController} which doesn't require this
018 *     wrapper.
019 */
020@Deprecated(since = "2022", forRemoval = true)
021public class PIDAnalogGyro extends AnalogGyro implements PIDSource {
022  private PIDSourceType m_pidSource = PIDSourceType.kDisplacement;
023
024  public PIDAnalogGyro(int channel) {
025    super(channel);
026  }
027
028  public PIDAnalogGyro(AnalogInput channel) {
029    super(channel);
030  }
031
032  public PIDAnalogGyro(int channel, int center, double offset) {
033    super(channel, center, offset);
034  }
035
036  public PIDAnalogGyro(AnalogInput channel, int center, double offset) {
037    super(channel, center, offset);
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Set which parameter of the gyro you are using as a process control variable. The Gyro class
042   * supports the rate and displacement parameters
043   *
044   * @param pidSource An enum to select the parameter.
045   */
046  @Override
047  public void setPIDSourceType(PIDSourceType pidSource) {
048    m_pidSource = pidSource;
049  }
050
051  @Override
052  public PIDSourceType getPIDSourceType() {
053    return m_pidSource;
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Get the output of the gyro for use with PIDControllers. May be the angle or rate depending on
058   * the set PIDSourceType
059   *
060   * @return the output according to the gyro
061   */
062  @Override
063  public double pidGet() {
064    switch (m_pidSource) {
065      case kRate:
066        return getRate();
067      case kDisplacement:
068        return getAngle();
069      default:
070        return 0.0;
071    }
072  }
073}
